Description: Fragment of neck and rising oval handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '340'. Name Archinos. Same die is used in examples in the Epigraphic Museum, Athens, and in Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 113, 35.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (48)
